channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Rubbish left in street for at least 6 days, 14th August
item.description:
The overflowing waste bin and rubbish on pavement has been there since at least Friday, 8th August. Presently on a double red line attracting vermin. This has been reported to the council by a few people.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 47-49, Streatham High Road, Streatham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicles, 14th August
item.description:
YK64 OZB K100 HOO GK05 OZW All the above cars have been abandoned in the road for about a month. They never move. They are blocking the view round the blind corner in and out of the road. They are blocking the view for neighbours getting out of their driveway and causing distress to older residents. They are making it difficult for the bin lorries and larger vehicles to enter the road, constantly blocking the close, it is a very small close. I am concerned emergency vehicles would not be able to reach the houses. Can these cars be moved? It is anti social behaviour how they have been parked and left with no consideration for the other residents. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Rosecroft Close, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping AGAIN, 14th August

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mottingham Lane, London
